20110121160102.000|20110121160105.000|TR0|shape, 75 percent say it's not.  That's

20110121160107.000|20110121160109.000|TR0|when just 18 percent thought the economy

20110121160112.000|20110121160114.000|TR0|was poor.

20110121161038.000|20110121161040.000|TR0|wasn't Isaac Seldada's (ph) lunch money he 
20110121161040.000|20110121161042.000|TR0|donated.  He raised the money by taking

20110121165313.000|20110121165315.000|TR0|DR. SANJAY GUPTA, CNN CHIEF MEDICAL 
20110121165315.000|20110121165317.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT (voice-over): Byron Janis 
20110121165317.000|20110121165320.000|TR0|has a rare gift.  He's played the classics 
20110121165320.000|20110121165322.000|TR0|from Chopin to Rachmaninoff to crowds at 
20110121165322.000|20110121165324.000|TR0|Carnegie Hall and for U.S. presidents.  
20110121165324.000|20110121165327.000|TR0|Yet for most of his career, he's been 
20110121165327.000|20110121165329.000|TR0|tormented by wrenching pain.
20110121165329.000|20110121165331.000|TR0|
20110121165331.000|20110121165334.000|TR0|BYRON JANIS, CONCERT PIANIST:  It started 
20110121165334.000|20110121165336.000|TR0|with a little patch of red on this finger 
20110121165336.000|20110121165338.000|TR0|inside, but it was very painful.
20110121165338.000|20110121165341.000|TR0|
20110121165341.000|20110121165343.000|TR0|GUPTA:  It was 1973, the height of his 
20110121165343.000|20110121165345.000|TR0|career, Janis was diagnosed with crippling

20110121165348.000|20110121165350.000|TR0|
20110121165350.000|20110121165352.000|TR0|JANIS:  At first, I just ignored it.  I

20110121165357.000|20110121165359.000|TR0|
20110121165359.000|20110121165401.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Simply not thinking about the pain

20110121165453.000|20110121165455.000|TR0|but then Janis became was depressed.  For 
20110121165455.000|20110121165457.000|TR0|a year, he refused to play.
